pageContext.claim: “In the two years before my inauguration, violent crime increased by 8 percent nationwide, and murders were up by more than 20 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: Violent crime and homicides increased in 2015 and 2016, but Trump is cherry-picking numbers and making it seem as though his policies stopped a surging wave of criminality. In reality, violent crime and homicides remained near historic lows even as they increased in 2015 and 2016. Experts say these years were an aberration -- Chicago, for example, had major unrest and a homicide spike in 2016. Violent crime resumed its decline in 2017.
